channel.title: Help with included files for client
channel.description:
Well I have been working on making a client for PicoScape, and I thank you all for leading me through some of it.
I just found a possible problem for me, on why I get a java heap space error. I haven't been packing .idx files with my jar maker. Since its not a default file. I have a list of file types I need to add. But one thing I need to add is a file that is named jkld or something like that. Really random, there are a few files like this in the same directory as the .wav files. But it has no assigned file type. It literally just called a "file" on my computer. How do I go about adding these files to the jar?

item.title: Help with included files for client
item.dc:creator: @gman035t gman035t
item.description:
@gman035t wrote:

Thats good advice, unfortunately my cache should include dark bow according to my friend. He got it for me. And if I did that then I wouldn’t have it would I? Also, if I do have to result to that, where it client.java would I find that path?[br][size=1]Posted on: August 28, 2007, 06:01:36 PM[/size][hr]How would I make my client read from the mopar cache?

Read full topic
item.source: Help with included files for client

item.title: Help with included files for client
item.dc:creator: @O_M_G1 O M G
item.description:
@O_M_G1 wrote:

Just pack the client but have it read from the mopar cache

Read full topic
item.source: Help with included files for client

Well I have been working on making a client for PicoScape, and I thank you all for leading me through some of it.
